results.title: Selective phytochemicals targeting pancreatic stellate cells as new anti-fibrotic agents for chronic pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer
results.text_hl: The aim of this review was to present a focused update on the selective new potential anti-fibrotic agents, including @CHEMICAL_Curcumin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003474 @@@curcumin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Resveratrol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077185 @@@resveratrol@@@, @CHEMICAL_rhein @CHEMICAL_MESH:C020491 @@@rhein@@@, @CHEMICAL_Emodin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004642 @@@emodin@@@, green tea @CHEMICAL_Catechin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002392 @@@catechin@@@ derivatives, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_eruberin_A @CHEMICAL_MESH:C000607823 @@@eruberin A@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Ellagic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004610 @@@ellagic acid@@@, in combating @<m>DISEASE_Cholangitis_Sclerosing</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015209 @@@PSC@@@ in @DISEASE_Pancreatitis_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D050500 @@@CP@@@ and @DISEASE_Pancreatic_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D010190 @@@PC@@@ models.

citations.NLM: Ramakrishnan P, Loh WM, Gopinath SCB, Bonam SR, Fareez IM, Mac Guad R, Sim MS, Wu YS. Selective phytochemicals targeting pancreatic stellate cells as new anti-fibrotic agents for chronic pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer Acta Pharm Sin B. 2020 Mar;10(3):399-413. PMID: 32140388
